description:
From March 12, 2020, Austria issues the recommendation to stop visits to elderly homes and hospitals. Although it is no ban, Austrians are strongly advised to stay away. Exceptions are in place for children as well as for palliative care.
This lasted till May 4. UPDATE: policy is not valid anymore

The administration of Vienna has issued new regulations (35. Verordnung) for visits in hospitals, nursing and care homes, starting from the the 29.05.2020. Visits are allowed again but only with mandatory masks and one visitor per 10 m2 in the patient rooms. Patients are only allowed to have one visitor per day, two visitors are only allowed in exceptions (such as childbirth, dementia, citical life phases). Visits of a person with potential symptoms of Covid 19 are still prohibited. Visits of children are only allowed in exceptions.
target_geog_level: One or more cities within a country

description: The administration of Vienna has issued new regulations (35. Verordnung) for visits in hospitals, nursing and care homes, starting from the the 29.05.2020. Visits are allowed again but only with mandatory masks and one visitor per 10 m2 in the patient rooms. Patients are only allowed to have one visitor per day, two visitors are only allowed in exceptions (such as childbirth, dementia, citical life phases). Visits of a person with potential symptoms of Covid 19 are still prohibited. Visits of children are only allowed in exceptions. UPDATE: From November 3rd, Austria announced a nationwide lockdown, which includes new regulations on visiting health facilities. Thus, this policy is not valid anymore.
target_geog_level: One or more cities within a country

description: The administration of Lower Austria has issues new regulations for hospital visits since the 01.06.2020. The general regulations for all visitors of patients within hospitals, care homes and other health spaces are the mandatory use of a mask, desinfection of hands, making an appointment beforehand, a minimum 1 meter distance between individuals and a maximum amount of visitors per room. However, individual hospital also have specific additional regulations, which vary in the allowed length of the visit (20 min to 45 min), specific visitation periods and testing when entering the main entrance.
target_geog_level: One or more cities within a country

description: The administration of Lower Austria has issues new regulations for hospital visits since the 01.06.2020. However, individual hospital also have specific additional regulations, which vary in the allowed length of the visit (20 min to 45 min), specific visitation periods and testing when entering the main entrance. UPDATE: From November 3rd, Austria announced a nationwide lockdown, which includes new regulations on visiting health facilities. Hence, this policy is not valid anymore.

description: Upper Austria (OÖ) has announced new hospital visit regulations according to the 4x1 Rule, starting from the 05.06.2020. Under this rule, a patient is allowed one visitor per day for one hour, most likely during the afternoon. Furthermore, hospitalized children are allowed to be visited by both parents, but not silmultaneously. Ambulance regulations stay the same and require 1,5 m distance betewen patients.
target_geog_level: One or more cities within a country

description: In Tyrol, hospital visit regulations have been allowed again since the 04.06.2020 but only under strict regulations. Patients, who have been staying at a hospital for more than a week, are allowed to have only one visitor per day for a maximum of 30 minutes. For people accompanying a patient into the hospital, Corona tests via smear testing are mandatory. Furthermore, individual hospitals have issues some additional regulations for their specific spaces.
target_geog_level: One or more cities within a country

description:
In Austria, starting September 1, Austrian Airlines is limiting the exceptions to the mask requirement.
Previously, passengers with a medical letter were exempt from wearing a mask when flying. Now, the medical letter must be written on an AUA-Formblatt, and passengers must provide a negative corona test result.
Since May, passengers have been required to wear masks upon entering the respective terminal until they arrive at their destination.
